Caused by: org.eclipse.core.commands.NotHandledException: There is no handler to execute.
 at org.eclipse.core.commands.Command.execute(Command.java:315)
 at org.eclipse.ui.internal.commands.CommandLegacyWrapper.execute(CommandLegacyWrapper.java:100)
 ... 44 more

The problem is caused by the registration of legacy actions as handlers.  In the old style, actions are registered multiple times: once for each menu location.  I'd hooked them up, but had forgotten to protect against this duplication.  Conflicts are detected and no handler wins....
Fixed in CVS.  The LegacyActionPersistence class checks to see if there will be a conflict.  If there will, then it simply doesn't add the legacy action as a handler.
Verified by the test suites in I20051213-0010.
